I'm a physician, educator, and researcher.

# Education

I graduated in Medicine from [Ben-Gurion University, Israel](https://in.bgu.ac.il/en/pages/default.aspx); completed my Master of Health Administration cum laude from [Bar-Ilan University, Israel](https://www.biu.ac.il/en); and am currently during my Ph.D. in quantitative epidemiology from [Tel-Aviv University, Israel](https://www.tau.ac.il/).

# Research experience

I have published over [40 scientific articles](https://scholar.google.co.il/citations?hl=en&user=ClzeE2UAAAAJ), received grants totaling 400K NIS + 40K USD, served as a [reviewer for eight journals](https://publons.com/researcher/1394431/avishai-m-tsur/), mentored MD students, and wrote [a book chapter](https://www.routledge.com/Fundamentals-of-Frontline-Surgery/Khan-Nott/p/book/9780367435592).

# Professional experience

I started volunteering as a first responder in [Magen David Adom, Israel](https://www.mdais.org/en). During my studies, I worked as a physician assistant in internal medicine. Later, I served as the director of physician assistants in [Soroka Medical Center, Israel](https://hospitals.clalit.co.il/soroka/en/Pages/default.aspx), where I did my internship. Currently, I'm an internal medicine resident at [Sheba Tel-Hashomer Medical Center, Israel](https://eng.sheba.co.il/)

# Teaching experience

For over eight years, I taught physics at [Ben-Gurion University, Israel](https://in.bgu.ac.il/en/pages/default.aspx) to biology, pharmacy, nursing, and medical students. Later, I taught leadership and tactical medicine to paramedics and physicians. Currently, I teach medical students internal medicine and [R](https://www.r-project.org/) for biomedical research.

# Awards

I won twice the Best Speaker award at the Israeli National Debating Championship (2013, 2014); an Intern's Award of Excellence from [Soroka Medical Center, Israel](https://hospitals.clalit.co.il/soroka/en/Pages/default.aspx); an Award of Excellence from the Technological and Logistics Directorate, Israel Defense Forces (2017). In 2019, an assay I first authored won a creative writing contest by the Technological and Logistics Directorate, Israel Defense Forces. In 2020, my team won a Medical Data Science Hackathon of the Israel Defense Forces Medical Corps.

# Research interests

My main research interest is cardiology. However, I love to clean and wrangle data of all sorts.
